content.webTitle: Out of school, less out of pocket

fields.headline: Out of school, less out of pocket
fields.bodyText: We compared ski prices for one week in January term time against February half-term for a family of four with two kids aged between five and 10. Mark Warner (0870 770 4226) has off-peak ski trips to St Anton, Austria, cheapest being the week starting 11 January. It would cost £2,712 for our family, including half-board with wine at Chalethotel Schweizerhof and return flights from Gatwick. · The same holiday, February half-term, would be £4,660 Price difference: £1,948 Esprit Ski (0125 261 8300) charges £1,322 for a family of four to stay for a week in the Chalet Hotel Sapiniere in Chamonix, France, departing 11 January, including flights and half board. · Flying 15 February, the same trip would cost £3,074 Price difference: £1,752 A stay at the Hotel Sunstar in Wengen, Switzerland, for seven nights half-board would cost from £2,281.60 with Inghams (020 8780 4433) based on a duplex room for four, including return flights from Gatwick leaving 17 January. · The same trip leaving 14 February would be £4,125.60 Price difference: £1,844 A holiday in Méribel, France, with Crystal (0870 160 6040) staying in the private Chalet Telemark would cost £1,138 for the family departing 10 January, including flights and half board. · Going at peak time, 14 February, would cost £1,882 Price difference: £744
